
```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
set.seed(121213)

# Random parameters
rf <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.04, sd = 0.002)        # risk-free rate (~4%)
mkt_ret <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.12, sd = 0.005)   # market return (~12%)
vol1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.16, sd = 0.01)       # volatility firm A
beta1 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.20, sd = 0.05)      # beta firm A
vol2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.14, sd = 0.01)       # volatility firm B
beta2 <- rnorm(1, mean = 0.55, sd = 0.05)      # beta firm B

# Equity costs of capital
r1 <- rf + beta1*(mkt_ret - rf)
r2 <- rf + beta2*(mkt_ret - rf)


```

Two companies in the consumer sector present the following estimates:

- Company A: volatility = `r round(vol1*100,1)`%, beta = `r round(beta1,2)`
- Company B: volatility = `r round(vol2*100,1)`%, beta = `r round(beta2,2)`
- Risk-free rate = `r round(rf*100,2)`%
- Expected market return = `r round(mkt_ret*100,2)`%
